Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery dinos or column-krater; interior: glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration representing the Calydonian boar hunt (part of two spears and hunter attacking on left with possible added red on chiton); boar, to left (only bristles and part of eye with red on neck below bristles remaining).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 267, no. B198)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0263) (Phase 1)
CVA Oxford II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum Great Britain 9 Oxford fasicule 2 (p. 94, pl. II, no. 17)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
